abstract: We discuss re-implement some features of standard Python library using a subset of Python itself (e.g. range, namedtuple, property, Enum, dataclass, etc.). This allows us to gain more in-depth understanding the mechanisms inside Python as well as introducing some obscure but useful Python features.
description:
In this talk, we discuss how some features in standard Python library can be manually re-implemented using a subset of Python itself. Examples include:
- built-in ``range`` function
- ``namedtuple`` class constructor
- ``property`` decorator
- ``Enum`` class (since Python 3.4)
- ``dataclass`` (since Python 3.7)
- etc.
Throughout the process of re-implementing these features, we should gain more in-depth understanding the mechanisms inside Python.



--------

Programmer: Specialized in problem solving, algorithm and data structure. Interested in robotics.
title: DIY: Python with partially charged batteries
